xml.episodeInfo:
FUTURAMA
Episode 501
CRIMES OF THE HOT
Aaron Ehasz Dave, The Neutral Planet
xml.info: Opening Credits. Caption: Known To Cause Insanity In Laboratory Mice.
Planet Express: Balcony. Its a scorching hot day and the crew are standing on the balcony in swimsuits. Leela is standing by an empty kiddie pool.
xml.speak: Hurry up with the water, I'm steaming in my own shell I am, it's that hot it is!
xml.info: Leela rips open a packet of Instant Pool Water (Just Add Water - Dead Leaves Included.)
xml.speak: Heyya!
xml.info: She empties the packet into the pool and squirts it with the hose. The pool fills with water with dead leaves floating on top. Enter Fry and Bender.
xml.speak: Man it's hot! (different voice.) How hot is it? (normal voice.) It's so hot I poured McDonalds Coffee in my lap to cool off. Jonny Carson said it.
xml.info: Nibbler starts to drink the pool water.
xml.speak: No! Nibbler, don't drink the pool water! It's full of chlorine!
xml.info: Nibbler finishes off the water and belches a green gas - chlorine! Everyone except Bender coughs and falls over unconcious. Bender laughs.
xml.speak: Lightweights! Oh wait - chlorine!
xml.info: He instantly rusts and falls over.
Planet Express: Meeting Room. The crew are slouched around the table sweating. Farnsworth is attaching an old filmstrip to Bender.
xml.speak: Perhaps this movie will help us take our minds off the heat.
(JITTERY) Focuuus!
xml.info: The movie is projected onto a screen with the title "Global Warming Or: None Like It Hot."
In the movie a little girl called Suzie walks out of an ice cream shop with a cone. It melts before she can take a lick. She cries. A man laughs. The regular filmstrip narrator walks into the frame.
xml.speak: IN MOVIE You're probably wondering why your ice cream went away. Well Suzie, the culprit isn't foreigners, it's global warming!
IN MOVIE Gwobal wappa?
IN MOVIE. Uh, yeah! Meet Mr Sunbeam. He comes all the way from the sun to visit Earth.
xml.info: As he speaks there is a scene of a sunbeam in a hat with a briefcase. It walks from the sun to Earth and raises its hat.
He walks away from the Earth but is stopped by gas things.
xml.speak: IN MOVIE Not so fast Sunbeam! We're Greenhouse Gases! You ain't going nowhere!
xml.info: More gases arrive and they beat up Mr Sunbeam.
xml.speak: IN MOVIE Pretty soon Earth is chock full of sunbeams......their rotting corpses heating our atmosphere.
xml.info: The gases laugh and the scene changes to a classroom.
xml.speak: IN MOVIE How do we get wid of the gweenhouse grasses?
IN MOVIE Fortunately our handsomest politicians came up with a cheap, last minute way to combat global warming. Ever since 2063 we drop a giant ice cube into the ocean every now and then.
xml.info: The movie cuts to a shot of a giant ice cube being dropped into the ocean.
xml.speak: IN MOVIE Just like Daddy puts in his drink every morning! (sadly) And then he gets mad.
IN MOVIE Of course, since the greenhouse gases are still building up, it takes more and more ice each time. Thus solving the problem once and for all.
IN MOVIE But...
xml.info: The movie quickly ends with the caption "The End."
xml.speak: Well, we just need one of those big ice cubes. Someone should call the losers who are supposed to deliver it. Hello?
xml.info: Nixon's head appears on the screen.
xml.speak: ON SCREEN President Nixon here. I'm hiring you losers to deliver the ice. And hurry up! I'm sweating like J. Edgar Hoover trying to squeeze into a new girdle!
xml.info: He cuts off.
xml.speak: You heard the good news everyone! Save the Earth, et cetera et cetera! Bye!
Wait! Where do we get the ice?
The wha? Oh Halley's Comet of course. The only sufficient source of ice cubes that don't have bugs in them!
Wow! Mining a comet, that sounds fun!
Yes there's no safer occupation than mining. Especially when you're on a snowball whipping through space at a million miles an hour! Safe!
xml.info: Halley's Comet. The ship flies in for it's landing. It has a giant cup tied to it. It lands. The cargo lift comes down. Bender moves a piece of machinery off the ship and onto the comet.
xml.speak: Deploying ice drill.
xml.info: He presses a button. The machine sprouts legs and grows to the same height as the ship. A thing comes out of the top of it. It turns into and ice dispenser.
xml.speak: Wow! That ice dispenser's so big, the ice crushes you! Yakov Smirnov said it!
No he didn't.
xml.info: Bender pushes the giant cup onto the ice dispenser.
xml.speak: Activating ice drill.
xml.info: The drill drills through the surface. Only a bit of grit comes through the dispenser.
xml.speak: Oh my God! It's out of ice! Like some outer space Motel 6!
xml.info: Leela gasps.
xml.speak: Completely out of ice?
This could mean the end of the bana daquiri as we know it...also life.
xml.info: Planet Express: Lounge. The crew are still sweltering. On the TV Morbo's head is inflating and deflating.
xml.speak: ON TV With Halley's Comet out of ice, Earth is experiencing the devastating effects of sudden intense global warming.
ON TV Morbo is pleased but sticky. The scorching heat has melted the polar ice caps causing floods of biblical proportions.
xml.info: The shot changes to a swamped city with an ark floating through it.
xml.speak: ON TV They called me crazy for building this ark.
ON TV You are crazy, you built it with same sex animal couples!
ON TV Hey! There are parts of the Bible I like and parts I don't like.
xml.info: The shot changes to a live windmill landscape.
xml.speak: ON TV Direct your attention now to the African turtles seen here migrating to cooler homes in Holland.
xml.info: A turtle rolls onto the back of its shell and can't get up.
xml.speak: (CRYING) That poor turtle!
Bender? Are you crying?
(CRYING) Uh no! Never!
xml.info: He wipes his eyes with windscreen wipers.
xml.speak: ON TV Morbo wishes these storward nomads peace among the Dutch tulips!
ON TV I'm sure those windmills will keep them cool.
xml.info: Outside Planet Express. The crew sit on some steps. The temperature reaches 120 Farenheit.
xml.speak: Well everybody, I just saved a turtle, what have you done with your lives?
You went all the way to Holland already?
xml.info: Bender points at his feet. He is wearing clogs. He dances.
xml.speak: Bender a turtle isn't yourself. Why do you care about it?
Because I also care deeply of things that remind me of myself. Like poor little Shelly here.
xml.info: He strokes the turtle.
xml.speak: What could you possibly have in common with this walking soup mix?
For one thing, we both have a tough outer shell. But lead a rich, inner life. Also...well you know...
You're both alcoholic, whore-mongering, chain smoking gamblers?
No! Its just...neither of us can get up when we get knocked on our back.
What? I've seen you get up off your back tons of times.
Those times I was slightly on my side.
Interesting. Maybe we should test this erectile disfunction of yours Bender.
xml.info: Everyone gets up and moves towards Bender.
xml.speak: Uh, that's not necessary, really! I think I hear my factory recalling me.
xml.info: Amy crouches behind Bender and he trips over her and he and the turtle land on their backs.
xml.speak: Oh! That's what I get for sharing my vulnerability with you people.
xml.info: A Civil Defence van drives past.
xml.speak: Calling all scientists, calling all scientists. Be advised there will be a worldwide conference on global warming in Kyoto, Japan.
xml.info: A man runs to the van.
xml.speak: I've got a degree in homeopathic medicine!
You've got a degree in baloney!
xml.info: The van sprays the scientist with a water cannon.
xml.speak: Professor Farnsworth, you're a scientist!
Forget it, I'm not going! I have my reasons! Shut up all of you!
Strange. You haven't acted suspicious since I found those "ape bones" in the basement.
My hip hurts! I'm in the middle of cooking a turkey! I have warranty cards to fill out! I'm not just making excuses! Alright I'll go!
xml.info: Outside Conference Centre. Scientists from all over the world arrive. Photographers take photos of them and fans in the crowd wave papers for them to sign. Joan Rivers' Head is commentating the star studded event.
xml.speak: Oh God I can't believe it! I love you!
xml.info: Farnsworth steps out of a limo.
xml.speak: Oh oh! It's Hubert Farnsworth! He's looking fab in a standard white lab coat and dark slacks! His wristwatch is Casio.
xml.info: Cut to: Conference Centre. The scientists are gathered in a huge room. The Civil Defence van pulls up on the stage.
xml.speak: Thank you all for coming! It is my pleasure to introduce the host of the Kyoto Global Warming Convention, the inventor of the environment and First Emperor of the Moon - Al Gore!
xml.info: Al Gore's Head in a jar rises up from the middle of the stage.
xml.speak: I have ridden the mighty Moon Worm.
xml.info: The audience goes wild.
xml.speak: Good for him!

My fellow Earthicans, as I discuss in my book, Earth In The Balance and the much more popular Harry Potter And The Balance Of Earth we need to defend our planet against pollution. As well as dark wizards.
xml.info: The audience cheers and a dark wizard who looks like Tim The Enchanter from Monty Python And The Holy Grail sulks.
xml.speak: Sure! Blame the wizards!
That's why I'm offering a bag of Moon Saphires to the scientist who can solve this problem once and for all. Lovely aren't they?
Sapphires? With those I could open the Gate Of Kerash!
First up is Professor Ogden Wernstrom.
xml.info: Wernstrom walks onto the stage.
xml.speak: Wernstrom!
Ahem. Ladies and Gentlemen. I have placed in orbit a giant mirror that will reflect 40% of the sun's rays. Thus cooling Earth. Observe.
xml.info: He presses a button and the roof opens up. The audience is blinded by the sunlight. Fry starts to pant.
Cut to: Space Mirror. The mirror moves around and starts to reflect the rays.
Cut to: Conference Centre. The room falls into shadow and Wernstrom dusts off his hands.
xml.speak: Problem solved.
xml.info: He laughs.
Cut to: Space Mirror. A piece of debris hits the mirror. It starts to spin and reflects more sunlight onto the Earth in a concentrated beam.
Cut to: City Street. A man shields his eyes.
xml.speak: Ooo, that's a little bright.
xml.info: The sunlight scorches the street and blows the man up.
Cut to: Conference Centre. The sunbeam cuts its way through the building. The audience run around panicking. Gore continues talking.
xml.speak: Alright, What else we got?
Professor, you're a Professor. You must have some ideas.
Absolutely not! I won't speak! I've got nothing to hide!
Our next speaker is -
I demand the floor!
Yes, it's your turn to speak.
Well nuts to me. I'm taking the stage! I know the source of the greenhouse gases. But in my shame I've kept it secret for 75 long years. Ohhh, it haunts my memory still.
xml.info: He holds a ray gun up to his head.
xml.speak: Professor no, don't do it!
Don't do what? Don't use this memory ray so I can remember what happened back then?
xml.info: He shoots himself. A blue glow envelopes his head.
Flashback - 75 years ago.
Mom's Friendly Robot Company: Farnsworth's Lab.
A prototype C3PO-like robot wakes up on the table. It looks around and sees Farnsworth.
xml.speak: Oh dear. Might I favour master with a tender kiss on the forehead?
xml.info: It kisses Farnsworth.
xml.speak: Oh dear, I've failed again.
xml.info: He presses a button and the robot is crushed ï¿½ la the Terminator in The Terminator.
xml.speak: Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear.
xml.info: Mom's Office. Mom is bashing Farnsworth's head on her desk.
xml.speak: Ooo, ouch, stop!
xml.info: Time Lapse. Farnsworth finishes making the first working robot.
The robot wakes up, drinks beer and belches fire.
xml.speak: What was that?
A flaming burp.
Does it always do that?
Its not always a burp. We still have one problem though. This robot will never meet emission standards.
Crap spackle! We'll just call it a sport utility robot and classify it as a light truck!
Well...I suppose the environment can take one more for the team.
xml.info: He starts to clean the robot.
Mom lies on a table.
xml.speak: Take me now you stud!
xml.info: He climbs on and they both...um. The robot carries on drinking.
Flashback ends.
xml.speak: Oh this is all my fault!
That's awful Professor. Especially the making out part.
Yeah, I didn't need to hear that.
All modern robots descend from my original smog blasting designs. And that's the cause of global warming today.
Uh, so the robots are to blame. As I suspected. We are left with only one possible course of action. Grim though it be.
I got a good feeling about this!
We must immediately and permanently shut down, dismantle and destroy all robots!
No!
Wait, surely there's a better -
xml.info: The Civil Defence Van interrupts him.
xml.speak: The conference is over.
I must go now, to help collect cans on Jupiter. Peace out ya'll!
xml.info: His jar sprouts rockets and he blasts off.
xml.speak: (CHANTING) Destroy all robots! Destroy all robots!
Poor Bender.
Be brave my friend.
xml.info: The turtle goes into its shell. So does Bender.
Planet Express: Lounge. Bender is still in his body. The crew are trying to coax him out.
xml.speak: Come on. You've got to come out of your chest sometime. Would you do it for a Bender snack?
xml.info: She opens it and tempts him with it. He reaches out to grab it but the crew all grab his arm.
xml.speak: Ah ha!
Gotcha!
FROM INSIDE Let me go! I don't even want the stupid beer! Yes! You tried to trick me into coming out of my chest. But who has the beer now? I've got mail.
xml.info: He reaches into his chest cabinet and pulls out a card with the words "It's A Party" on it.
xml.speak: Ooo, it's a party. Apparently.
xml.info: Nixon's head appears in the card.
xml.speak: IN CARD Do you like to party? To boogie down? Well I'm throwing an all night beach raver for my robot pals. It all goes down Saturday on the isolated Galapogas Islands where there will be no escape - from the fun! All robots must attend!

Strange. Why would Nixon, an awkward, uncomfortabble man suddenly throw a party? One of the most social events imaginable. It's a trap is why! They're going to deactivate all the robots! I don't hear any gasping.
We all figured that out.
Ohh!
Well, I'm off.
xml.info: Fry blocks the door.
xml.speak: Wait. We could hide you! We'll pile fruit on you and claim you're a bowl.
No. I'm going to the party.
xml.info: Fry puts a banana skin on Bender's head.
xml.speak: I won't let you.
Fry, as you know, there are lots of things I'm willing to kill for. Jewels, vengence, Father O'Mally's weedwhacker. But at long last I've found something I'm willing to die for. This mindless turtle.
Bender, this world isn't good enough for you.
Not even close. Goodbye everybody. Don't touch my stuff after I'm dead! (shouting) It's booby trapped.
xml.info: Robot Party. The robots party on a ship. Then they cross the desert on camels. Then they swing through a jungle. Then they go to a fair. Then they party on the Galapogas islands. Bender looks at his turtle.
xml.speak: Poor guy. Maybe you'd feel better if I had a drink. Crummy kegg it's completely ta - Oh you're a robot.
Don't stop!
Ew!
xml.info: Nixon takes the stage.
xml.speak: Attention happenin' robots. Who's got what it takes to party with Nixon? You fellas enjoy yourselves for the next two hours. And be sure not to leave the island, uh for at least two hours! I'm going out to pick up some smokes. Uh really good smokes! Two hours. OK headless body of Agnoo, lets blow this joint!
xml.info: The body growls and carries Nixon to a helicopter. Bender watches the helicopter fly away.
xml.speak: Nah, I'm not really in the -
xml.info: She shakes him around. Bender panics.
Nixon's Helicopter. It is now flying through space towards Wernstrom's mirror.
xml.speak: Per your orders I have modified my mirror to fire a colossal electromagnetic pulse at the Galapogas. Every robot will be instantly and painfully terminated. Now for your part of the bargain.
Oh, very well. Agnoo, you belong to Wernstrom now.
xml.info: Agnoo growls.
Galapogas Islands. Bender is talking to his turtle.
xml.speak: I have to say goodbye now. There ain't not turtles where daddy's a-going. (whispering) Don't tell anybody but Nixon's about to shut all robots off and -
xml.info: A boom mic robot hangs over Bender.
xml.speak: What??
xml.info: There is bedlam with the robots.
xml.speak: (SHOUTING) We're gonna die!
(SHOUTING) Nixon's not bringing the smokes!
xml.info: Bender takes control.
xml.speak: Shut up and pay attention to me! Bender. Look, I love life and its pleasures as much as anyone here, except perhaps you Hedonismbot. But we need to be shut off! Especially you Hendonismbot!
I apologise for nothing!
We pollute too much. We're destroying the world and killing the turtles.
To hell with the turtles!
No one insults the turtles!
xml.info: He punches Preacherbot.
xml.speak: Oh mercy.
xml.info: He pulls out a knife and he and Bender fight.
xml.speak: Let the games begin!
xml.info: It chuckles. The Planet Express ship flies in and lands. Fry and Leela carry the Professor out and stand him in front of the microphone on the stage.
xml.speak: Everyone listen!
xml.info: The robots stop fighting. Bender punches Preacherbot again. He falls over.
xml.speak: Aw damn!
I've devised a way to save you and to stop global warming at the same time! Granted you're all blasting out greenhouse gases.
You're one to talk!
xml.info: Preacherbot hits him with a chair. He falls over onto his back. He tries to get up but can't.
xml.speak: But we can use those very gases to save the planet. If you all vent your exhaust directly upward in one burst it should thrust the Earth further from the sun, thus cooling it. By my calculations we'll need the full force of every last robot. So quickly, everyone point your exhaust vents straight upwards. Now vent! Vent like the wind! Harder! Harder!
Why isn't this working?!
Some lazy or polite robot is holding it in.
xml.info: Bender is still on his back, unable to vent.
xml.speak: Help! Help!!
xml.info: Cut to: Nixon's Helicopter. Wernstrom is turning the mirror towards the robots.
Cut to: Galapogas Islands. The robots continue to vent but to no avail.
xml.speak: A billion robot lives are about to be extinguished! Oh the Jedi's are going to feel this one!
xml.info: Bender and the turtle are still on their backs.
xml.speak: I'm sorry buddy. At least we'll die on our backs, helpless. Huh? What the hell are you doing? Hey are you trying to make me look bad? Ah ha! I'm even greater than I thought I was! And now to fullfill my destiny.
xml.info: He stands on his hands and vents. The flame grows bigger and the Earth moves.
Nixon's Helicopter.
xml.speak: Fire!! What the??
We missed.
xml.info: Agnoo growls.
Galapogas Islands. The skies have cleared and the crew are standing on the stage. Nixon is with them.
xml.speak: Professor, for saving the Earth and foiling me, I proudly, yet angrily, present you with Earth's new highest honour: The Polluting Medal Of Pollution.
xml.info: He hangs the medal around Farnsworth. The industrial chimneys on the medal blow smoke in Farnsworth's face making him cough.
xml.speak: Thank you. I deserve this!
xml.info: The robots cheer.
xml.speak: Hey Professor! Now that the Earth's orbit is further from the sun won't that make the year longer?
Why yes! One week longer to be exact.
In that case I hereby declare it Robot Party Week!
xml.info: The robots cheer and dance to Buster Poindexter and his Banshees Of Blue's Hot Hot Hot. Then they vent.
THE END
